plan_metadata.name: PODIUM ADVANCED GOAT
plan_metadata.target_athlete: Elite cyclist, podium contender, can commit 20-25 hrs/week, GOAT pursuit
plan_metadata.goal: Complete race preparation through pyramidal base with strategic intensity integration—all systems developed, peak race fitness

workouts.name: W01 Mon - Rest
workouts.description: • Welcome to PODIUM Advanced GOAT. You're chasing something exceptional—20-25 hours per week, 12 weeks to race-day peak. This is the Integrated Pyramidal approach: massive aerobic base with strategic intensity throughout. Elite gravel racing demands everything—you have the time to train everything. • WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has comprehensive testing. Wednesday is volume + technique. Thursday has durability assessment. Friday is easy. Saturday is peak long base (5-6 hours). Sunday has multi-system quality. • GOAT PHILOSOPHY: Volume is the foundation. Intensity is the sharpening. At 20-25 hours/week, you have enough volume to develop all systems. We'll train VO2max, threshold, durability, and neuromuscular throughout—not in isolated blocks, but integrated intelligently. • REST DAY NOTE: True rest. You're about to do serious work. Sleep 8+ hours tonight.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W01 Tue - Comprehensive Testing Protocol
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: 40 min warmup (progressive) → 5 min all-out → 10 min recovery → 20 min max effort → 15 min easy → 3 min all-out → 10 min easy → 1 min all-out → 20 min cooldown • Full power profile: 20-min FTP, 5-min VO2max, 3-min anaerobic, 1-min neuromuscular. At elite level, every system matters. Record everything—these numbers guide your training. • ELITE CONTEXT: Don't compare to others. Your numbers, your progression. Elite is about extracting your maximum, not matching someone else's. • CADENCE: Self-selected for all tests.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="2400" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.78"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="300" Power="1.20"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="1.05"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="180" Power="1.25"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="60" Power="1.50"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1200" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W01 Wed - Volume + Technique
workouts.description: • Duration: 3-4 hours @ Z2 (65-75% FTP) • Pure aerobic volume. Focus on pedaling technique—smooth circles, engage glutes, eliminate dead spots. At elite volume, efficiency matters enormously. • TECHNIQUE FOCUS: Every 20 min, do 1 min single-leg focus (mentally isolate one leg). Then 1 min spin-ups (120+ rpm for 15 sec, recover, repeat 3x). • CADENCE: Mix—some high (95-105), some low (65-75), mostly self-selected.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="12600" Power="0.70" Cadence="90"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W01 Thu - Durability + LT1 Assessment
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: 30 min warmup → 30 min @ 72-75% FTP (LT1 zone—stable HR, nasal breathing) → 15 min easy → 4x20 min @ 85-90% FTP (8 min easy between, monitor power/HR stability) → 30 min cooldown • LT1 assessment + durability check. Can you hold 85-90% for 80 minutes with stable output? Power decay >5% or HR drift >10 bpm = durability limiter identified. • DURABILITY PRINCIPLE: Gravel races are 4-12 hours. Your ability to maintain power at hour 8 matters more than hour 1. This is your durability baseline. • CADENCE: Mix—high/low/self-selected across blocks.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1800" Power="0.73"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="1200" OnPower="0.875" Cadence="90" OffDuration="480" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W01 Fri - Easy Recovery
workouts.description: • Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2 (60-70% FTP) • True recovery. Tomorrow is a big day. Don't sabotage it with junk miles today. • RECOVERY NOTE: At elite volume, recovery quality determines training quality. Prioritize sleep, nutrition, stress management.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.65" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W01 Sat - Long Pyramidal Base
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: Pyramidal distribution—75% Z2, 18% Z3, 7% Z4/Z5 First 3 hours Z2 → 4x15 min @ 80-85% FTP (tempo, 5 min easy between) → 3x5 min @ 100-105% FTP (5 min easy) → Final 1-1.5 hours Z2 • Long pyramidal ride—mostly easy, some tempo, brief hard efforts. This is sustainable high-volume distribution. Elite endurance is built on massive aerobic volume with intensity integration. • NUTRITION: 80-100g carbs/hour. Practice race nutrition exactly. At 5-6 hours, fueling is non-negotiable. • CADENCE: Mix throughout—high on tempo, varied on threshold.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="10800" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.825" Cadence="95" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="300" OnPower="1.02" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="4500" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W01 Sun - Multi-System Quality
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: 30 min warmup → 4x4 min @ 110-115% FTP (VO2, 4 min easy) → 20 min easy → 2x15 min @ 95-100% FTP (threshold, 8 min easy) → 60 min Z2 + • Multi-system development: VO2 + threshold in one session. At elite volume, you can handle this. Should be hard but achievable.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="240" OnPower="1.12" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="90" OffDuration="480" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="3600" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W02 Mon - Rest
workouts.description: • Week 2 builds volume foundation. Intensity stays present but aerobic development dominates. You're building the engine that powers everything else. • WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has VO2 development. Wednesday is volume + tempo. Thursday has threshold work. Friday is easy. Saturday is peak long (6+ hours). • REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest. You're recovering from Week 1 testing and preparing for serious volume.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W02 Tue - VO2max Development
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: 30 min warmup → 5x4 min @ 110-115% FTP (4 min easy between) → 20 min cooldown • VO2max work. These should be very hard—can't talk, gasping. 20 minutes total at VO2 zone. This builds the ceiling your threshold sits under. • ELITE CONTEXT: At your volume, VO2 work isn't about survival—it's about development. Push hard, recover well. • CADENCE: High (100+ rpm) on all intervals.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.78"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="5" OnDuration="240" OnPower="1.12" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1200" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W02 Wed - Volume + Tempo Blocks
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: First 2 hours Z2 → 4x20 min @ 78-82% FTP (5 min easy between) → Final 1.5 hours Z2 • Extended tempo within volume. 80 minutes at tempo develops metabolic efficiency. Should feel controlled, sustainable. • TEMPO PRINCIPLE: Tempo is durability training. It teaches your body to sustain moderate intensity for hours—exactly what gravel racing demands. • CADENCE: Self-selected on tempo, mix on Z2.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="7200" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="1200" OnPower="0.80" Cadence="90" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W02 Thu - Threshold Development
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: 25 min warmup → 3x15 min @ 95-100% FTP (8 min easy between) → 15 min cooldown • Threshold intervals. 45 minutes at race pace. This is what gravel racing feels like—sustained high output. • THRESHOLD PRINCIPLE: Your threshold defines sustainable race pace. Higher threshold = faster sustainable speed. • CADENCE: Mix—interval 1 high, interval 2 low, interval 3 self-selected.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.78"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="95" OffDuration="480" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W02 Fri - Easy Recovery
workouts.description: • Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2 • Recovery before big weekend. Truly easy.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>

workouts.name: W02 Sat - Peak Long Pyramidal
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: Pyramidal: 73% Z2, 18% Z3, 9% Z4/Z5 First 3.5 hours Z2 → 5x15 min @ 80-85% FTP (5 min easy between) → 4x4 min @ 105-110% FTP (4 min easy) → Final 1.5 hours Z2 • Peak long ride for Base phase. 6-6.5 hours with integrated intensity. This is elite preparation—massive volume with quality embedded. • NUTRITION: 90-100g carbs/hour. You're burning 800-1000 calories/hour at this intensity. Practice race fueling exactly. • CADENCE: Mix throughout.

<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>

workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: 30 min warmup → 3x5 min @ 108-112% FTP (5 min easy) → 15 min easy → 2x12 min @ 95-100% FTP (6 min easy) → 60 min Z2 + • VO2 + threshold combo. Tired legs from Saturday make this race-specific—handling intensity when fatigued.

workouts.name: W03 Mon - Rest
workouts.description: • Week 3 is peak Base volume. Maximum aerobic loading before recovery week. This is the biggest week—embrace it. • WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has extended VO2. Wednesday is volume + extended tempo. Thursday has peak threshold. Friday is easy. Saturday is peak long (6.5+ hours). • REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest. You need it.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W03 Tue - Extended VO2max
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: 30 min warmup → 6x4 min @ 108-112% FTP (4 min easy between) → 20 min cooldown • Extended VO2 session. Six intervals—should be very challenging by interval 5-6. This is VO2 overload. • CADENCE: High (100+ rpm) throughout.

workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: First 2 hours Z2 → 5x20 min @ 78-82% FTP (5 min easy between) → Final 1.5 hours Z2 • 100 minutes at tempo within 5-hour ride. Peak durability development. Should feel controlled but accumulating fatigue. • CADENCE: Self-selected on tempo.

workouts.name: W03 Thu - Peak Threshold
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: 25 min warmup → 2x20 min @ 95-100% FTP (10 min easy between) → 3x3 min @ 110% FTP (3 min easy) → 15 min cooldown • Peak threshold session. 40 minutes at race pace + VO2 bursts. This is race simulation intensity. • CADENCE: Threshold mix, VO2 high.

This is what elite gravel preparation looks like. Practice EVERYTHING—nutrition (100g carbs/hour), hydration, gear, mental focus. • ELITE CONTEXT: This ride equals or exceeds most gravel race durations. You're building race-day durability. • CADENCE: Mix throughout.

workouts.name: W04 Mon - Rest
workouts.description: • Recovery week. Three weeks of progressive overload needs absorption. Your body adapts during rest, not training. By Sunday you should feel fresh, powerful, eager. • WEEK PREVIEW: Light intensity Tuesday. Easy Wednesday-Thursday. Friday rest. Moderate Saturday. Easy • REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest. Extra sleep. This is where gains materialize.

workouts.name: W06 Sat - Peak Long Race Simulation
workouts.description: • STRUCTURE: First 3 hours Z2 → 5x20 min @ 93-98% FTP (8 min easy between) → 5x4 min @ 108-112% FTP (4 min easy) → Final 1.5 hours Z2 • PEAK RIDE. 7-7.5 hours. 100 min race pace + 20 min VO2. This is what elite gravel preparation looks like. Test EVERYTHING—nutrition (100-110g carbs/hour), hydration, gear, mental focus, pacing. • ELITE CONTEXT: This ride meets or exceeds most gravel race durations and intensities. You're building race-day resilience. • CADENCE: Mix throughout.

    <IntervalsT Repeat="5" OnDuration="30" OnPower="1.12" Cadence="100" OffDuration="90" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.65" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W12 Sat - Race Day or Rest
workouts.description: • If racing Saturday: RACE DAY—EXECUTE YOUR PLAN • If racing Sunday: Complete rest or 45-60 min with brief openers • Race Day Notes: 12 weeks of GOAT-level preparation. 20-25 hours per week. Integrated pyramidal development. All systems trained. You've built race-day resilience through massive volume with embedded quality. • START STRATEGY: Controlled first 30 minutes. Find your group. Settle into race pace. • NUTRITION: 90-100g carbs/hour minimum. You've practiced this. • EXECUTION: Race pace is 87-92% FTP (G-Spot). Push surges when you see opportunity. • FINISH: Second half is where you dominate. Your durability is exceptional.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W12 Sun - Race Day or Recovery
workouts.description: • If racing Sunday: RACE DAY—EXECUTE YOUR PLAN • If raced Saturday: 45-60 min easy spin, celebrate, recover • Race Day Notes: You've done GOAT-level work. 20-25 hours per week. Massive aerobic base with integrated intensity. Your VO2max is sharp. Your threshold is race-ready. Your durability is exceptional. You've practiced everything—nutrition, pacing, gear. • GOAT EXECUTION: Start smart. Fuel constantly. Push the second half. When it hurts at hour 5, remember—you've trained longer and harder than this. Your preparation is exceptional. Now dominate.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

integrated_pyramidal_philosophy.description: Integrated Pyramidal Progression (GOAT Method) - massive aerobic base with strategic intensity throughout
integrated_pyramidal_philosophy.intensity_distribution: Pyramidal base (Z2 dominant) with VO2, threshold, and durability work integrated throughout—not isolated blocks
integrated_pyramidal_philosophy.principle: At elite volume, you have time to train everything. Volume is foundation, intensity is sharpening.

pyramidal_distribution.long_ride_structure: Aerobic base → tempo blocks → brief threshold/VO2 → aerobic finish
pyramidal_distribution.intensity_integration: Quality embedded in volume, not separate

multi_system_development.durability: Extended tempo (80-92% FTP) within long rides
multi_system_development.neuromuscular: Short surges (30-60 sec @ 115-120%) during race sharpening

gspot_terminology.context: Race pace for gravel—sustainable power for 3-12 hours

cadence_work.vo2_efforts: High cadence (100+ rpm) to maximize oxygen delivery

strength_training.note: Athlete performs own strength program. Phases: Max (Weeks 1-4), Power (Weeks 4-6), Maintenance (Weeks 6-12).

monday_week_preview.description: Monday rest days include week preview, GOAT philosophy reminders, and elite context

elite_volume_context.weekly_volume_range: 20-25 hours at peak, 9-13 hours recovery weeks
elite_volume_context.recovery_emphasis: Quality recovery drives quality training—sleep 8+ hours, nutrition priority
